OCD.name: Nvidia Triton Server
OCD.description: Configuration for the Local Container Nvidia Triton Server

AD.name: Image name
AD.description: The image the container will be created with.

AD.name: Image tag
AD.description: Describes which image version that should be used for creating the container.

AD.name: Nvidia Triton Server ports
AD.description: The ports used to connect to the server for HTTP, GPRC and Metrics services.

AD.name: Local model repository path
AD.description: Specify the path on the filesystem where the models are stored.

AD.name: Local model decryption password
AD.description: Specify the password to be used for decrypting models stored in the model repository. If none is specified, models are supposed to be plaintext.

AD.name: Inference Models
AD.description: A comma separated list of inference model names that the server will load.

AD.name: Optional configuration for the local backends
AD.description: A semi-colon separated list of configuration for the backends. i.e. tensorflow,version=2;tensorflow,allow-soft-placement=false

AD.name: Memory
AD.description: The maximum amount of memory the container can use in bytes. Set it as a positive integer, optionally followed by a suffix of b, k, m, g, to indicate bytes, kilobytes, megabytes, or gigabytes. The minimum allowed value is platform dependent (i.e. 6m). If left empty, the memory assigned to the container will be set to a default value by the native container orchestrator.

AD.name: CPUs
AD.description: Specify how many CPUs the Triton container can use. Decimal values are allowed, so if set to 1.5, the container will use at most one and a half cpu resource.

AD.name: GPUs
AD.description: Specify how many Nvidia GPUs the Triton container can use. Allowed values are 'all' or an integer number. If there's no Nvidia GPU installed, leave the field empty.

AD.name: Timeout (in seconds) for time consuming tasks
AD.description: Timeout (in seconds) for time consuming tasks like server startup, shutdown or model load. If the task exceeds the timeout, the operation will be terminated with an error.

AD.name: Max. GRPC message size (bytes)
AD.description: Maximum accepted input size for the GRPC calls. Increase this value if the model input size is bigger than the default.
